boardgame.name: Wait for me
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb

WAIT FOR ME is a 22-day journaling game about time travel and connection, for one or two players.

In this time of social distance we may feel trapped and untethered. What if you could glimpse the future or relive the past? In WAIT FOR ME, build a handwritten journal and write yourself messages in your own diary about what was and will be in this game about longing, memory, and forgiveness.

In WAIT FOR ME you are building your own handwritten journal of messages to your past and future self. As the time-traveling player you will combine hand-written entries with physical ephemera like receipts and photos. You will create an artifact of play that is completely unique to your experience.

WAIT FOR ME is an unusual game in that it combines journaling, storytelling, and memories of your own past. You're creating something with both your words and the way you put them down. That means thinking through events in your life -- and thinking about how they might be different if you could talk to yourself about them first.

boardgame.name: Times Table Heroes
boardgame.description: Master times table from 1 to 12 with these games. Practice 2, 5 and 10 times tables with Multiplication Bingo, or flip over the board to play Times Table Heroes. Save the city by solving multiplication sums, overcoming disasters with your unique superhero powers, and be the first to defeat the evil robot.

boardgame.name: Tales of Arena
boardgame.description:
Ever since its discovery, magic has been a source of conflict accross the Realm. Over time, factions have used it to tame the elements of their land, repel invaders and conquer enemies. When war finally erupted, the world was plunged into darkness for decades. Peace seemed unattainable until leaders agreed on the foundation of the Magic Council, a committee in charge of legislating the use of magic across the Realm and prohibiting it during warfare.
To elect members of the Council, a representative of each faction was sent as their champion to compete in a tournament called Arena. In this tournament, champions used all their magic powers to battle each other in an epic clash. The winner claimed the throne of the Magic Council, while the others were assigned a title proportional to their performance. Arena became a tradition and remains to this day how members of the council are elected every year.

Tales of Arena is a 3-round arena skirmish game. It can be played by 3 to 4 players.
To start the game, each player is assigned a champion and a map is set in the arena. Each round starts with a market phase where players provide their champion with gear. Then, players unleash their champion’s magic powers to defeat each other during the arena phase. Fortunately, champions can not die in the arena. When they are drained (0HP), they are removed momentarily but come back their next turn by their starting gate. This is made possible by the soul pool, a device that can exchange souls to save champions. It has a finite number of souls though, so when it is emptied, the round ends and Victory Points are given to each player. A new map is then set, and players can further equip their champion during the following market phase. After three rounds, the player with the most Victory Points wins the game, and as such their champion wins the throne of the Magic Council!

boardgame.name: Cartographers
boardgame.description: App version of the Flip & Write game Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale.

boardgame.name: Agents: Sword and Shield – Big Game
boardgame.description: Agents Sword and Shield: Big Game is a first expansion to the Zvezda's game Agents Sword and Shield. This expansion adds 2 new factions: the German Stasi and the PRC MGB. Thus, up to six players can now take part in the game. In the expansion there is a new mechanic of the revolution that can occur in third world countries. Revolutions provide players with the ability to make new tactical decisions in the game. Also, the expansion include a new type of agent - influence agent, which allows a draw in favor of a player who has such an agent in the region.

boardgame.name: Smirkle: the saracastic "sorry about that" dice game
boardgame.description: Smirkle is a dice game that is as fun as chasing chickens. The points add up fast and the risk is very high. Shoot you might as well get the pickup or risk it for a biscuit. You always start with the smirkle dice and then roll the 8-sided dice. Get three of a kind and other combinations to win quickly.

boardgame.name: Murder on the Primewater Pleasure
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The characters recently did Gellan Primewater, a local merchant from the Town of Saltmarsh, a great service by recovering property deeds worth a large sum of money, that he had long thought lost. In return Gellan throws a party for them on his pleasure ship, the Primewater Pleasure.

However, this weekend cruise is plunged into chaos when one of the guests is murdered. The party must dive in and find the murderer before the ship gets back to shore, and the murderer can escape.

This is a murder mystery which includes full colour maps of the Primewater Pleasure (player versions included). Fleshed out NPCs with motivations and secrets, as well as clues for your players to find, all in an attempt to uncover the truth. Your characters are trapped on the ship with the murderer and must find them before they strike again. Like all good murder mysteries this one contains a rather dungeons and dragons style twist.

The table of contents includes links to all NPCs as well as every chapter for that sweet sweet quality of life improvement.

This adventure is designed for 4th level characters. It is designed to fit in with the Ghosts of Saltmarsh campaign but could also fit in to any setting or even be its own standalone adventure.

This is my first adventure so all of your support would be greatly appreciated! I hope you enjoy and I welcome any feedback you might have!

boardgame.name: Chachapoya: KÍGYÓ Kalandor Promókártyák
Chachapoya: SNAKE Adventurer Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
The base Chachapoya game is expanded by 3 new different adventurer cards. We shuffle the SNAKE Adventurer promo cards into the adventurer's deck, then prepare the other cards as its written in the game rules.

THE TORCH: The player leading The Torch card can check the hidden treasure card but he cannot show it to the other players!

THE MAP: The player leading The Map card can switch the hidden treasure to the bottom treasure card in the drawing deck.

THE COMPASS: The player leading The Compass turns over the hidden treasure card to show it to all of the players.
In other cases follow the original game rules.

Enjoy playing the game and have fun with treasure hunting!

-description from designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Circus Break
boardgame.description:
Circus Break is a fast-paced card flipping game, which involves players competing with each other, in order to obtain a key to escape from the circus that is run by a horrible owner.

Each player receives a unique character at the start of the game, which needs to be hidden until you wish to use the characters' abilities.
You will need to identify turned-over cards and use them wisely to process the game, read more cards, obstruct others etc. , and eventually be the first to escape the circus by using the key.

Our game contains different character abilities, varieties of action cards, random game-changing events. This will create countless situations and make our gameplay more exciting and fascinating.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Any Emotion
boardgame.description:
A game to learn to distinguish and know the primary emotions.
Includes several game modes.

Game mode: EmoVeloz
Objective of the game:
Get the highest number of cards at the end of the game.

Game preparation:
All the cards are shuffled and stacked face down. A player takes a card and separates it from the rest and indicates what data must be located as indicated by the rocket pencil on the back of the removed card.
How to play:
When all the players are ready, one player turns over the top card of the deck. All players at the same time and without touching the card will have to search for the data. The first to say it out loud and cover the letter will get the letter set aside as a point.
The letter that was face up is left to one side, but in this case face down in order to see what the rocket pencil indicates.
The data to look for in the charts are the following:
Red (number): the emotion that is repeated the number of times indicated by the card (joy, sadness, surprise or anger)
Purple (sex): the largest group represented on the card (boy-girl). In the event of a tie, “tie” must be indicated.
Blue (hair): it will be necessary to discover which hair color is the most numerous in the group of boys and girls on the chart.

When there is only one letter left, it will be turned over to check what data to look for (what the rocket pencil marks). When everyone is ready, it is turned around again and the players try to be the fastest to discover the data.

Game over:
When the deck of cards is finished the players will count the cards obtained. The participant who has collected the most cards will be the winner. In case of a tie, all are winners! Shall we play another?
RECOMMENDATIONS: It is highly advisable to play the first few times with a single data to search, that is, it is always the same data for the entire game. You can start looking in the cards for hair color, the next game look for the majority in sex and in the third look for the coincidence in the number of repetitions of the same emotion that indicates the back of the card.

Un juego para conocer y reconocer las principales emociones con diversos modos de juego

boardgame.name: Eysenhudt: Adaptives Kampf System
boardgame.description:
The Adaptive Combat System is a Mini Expansion for Eysenhudt to make battle more adaptive and thus more challenging. The basic thought behind the Adaptive Combat System is: the more power in arms your army – the »Heller Haufen« – is able to mass, the more aware the targets’ defenders will become of your armaments. So they will most likely adapt!
Thus battle against the important fortified towns will become more challenging than ever (and regardless of your actual attack's potential). After you have computed your strength you determine the difficulty-level against which to compete with the help of a rotary dial and a dice roll. Each difficulty-level (the basic copper ~, the silver ~, the gold ~, the palladium ~ and the plutonium level) comes with its own set of Battle Cards and with its own die. So, in the hardest case you've to compete against a D16 with a lessened probability of rolling the lower values (but also, of course, of rolling a total failure). Thus, with increased difficulty the luck-factor (or bad-dice-roll-factor) decreases.
This Mini Expansion is meant to be optional and for all who want to try a new challenge when going into battle.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 100 Snow and Ice Encounters - Supplement for Zweihander RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a collection of 100 different events and encounters that characters could have whilst travelling through snow and icebound regions. Some of the encounters are most suited to polar regions and those lands nearest to them, others could be located in snowy mountains or perhaps simply during a heavy winter. Some of the encounters are odd and some are potentially hazardous. They can be used to enliven otherwise boring travel, or perhaps even be a source of adventure hooks.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

By the shore of some open water is an upside-down kayak made from sealskins over a whalebone frame. The kayak will take two, and there are two single paddles, also made from whalebone, resting on the kayak's side. The owners of the kayak cannot be seen.

Carved from a huge block of ice is a statue of a man in armour. The statue is 20' tall and appears to have only recently been made as it lacks any signs of melting.

Clouds appear on the horizon and rapidly approach the party. When they arrive, the wrap the characters in a howling blizzard. Visibility drops to almost nothing and only by touch can other characters and creatures be found. The blizzard will dump several feet of snow whilst it lasts and quickly making shelter is advisable (see Extreme Weather in the Hazards & Healing chapter of the ZWEIHÄNDER: Revised Core Rulebook).

Cracking noises come from an ice-covered river. The ice on top of the river starts breaking apart and the river starts flowing freely once more.

Cut into the side of a glacier is a tunnel 10' in diameter, 3' above the ground. The sides of the tunnel are perfectly smooth and it leads deep into the ice. As the tunnel would be distorted when the glacier moves (a (Routine +10%) Education Test to confirm), the fact that it is still perfectly straight suggests that it hasn't been here that long.

Two pages are the front and rear covers and one page is ads.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Entertainers and Artists to See on the Street
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a collection of 100 different entertainers and artists, of varying levels of skill from none upwards, who could be seen in a fantasy setting. Some are technically not performers at all, even though they may draw a crowd. They are aimed at being street performers, but they could be seen in other places, such as carnivals, fairs and taverns, although some are not suitable for indoor performances. The entertainers can be used as background colour for a suitable setting, and some have peculiarities that are a source of potential adventure hooks.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Madame Blatsky is a sight in extensive skirts, hundreds of bangles and necklaces and beringed fingers, together with excessive makeup. She claims to be a palm reader, descended from a long line of such, who have travelled the world. In truth, Madame Blatsky is no such thing, and she isn't sure just who is in her line. She grew up in the city and discovered a talent for telling people what they want to hear in a way that makes them willing to pay.

Magic Dancers are a dance troupe consisting of low-powered spell users. They use minor magics and cantrips in their performances to enhance the show with such as sounds and illusionary effects, but they are in and of themselves talented dancers. The magic simply enhances the show, putting it a step up from others, rather than being the entirety of their performance.

Malc Turmoil is a juggler in brightly-patterned clothes of clashing colours. He specialises in juggling sharp objects and those that are on fire. In every performance, he always drops an item, to ensure that people stay in the macabre hope Malc will cut himself or accidentally set himself on fire.

Malice is a man, or perhaps a woman, in a half mask and scarlet painted lips. The upper half of the mask is made from white china with no holes for eyes, so it's uncertain how Malice sees, yet they clearly do. Malice makes fun of those passing in a hoarse, rasping voice, picking up on any of their traits and exaggerating and making fun of them to degrees that have reduced more than a few targets to tears. Malice doesn't seem to want paying; they just want to cut as many people to ribbons with their tongue as they can.

Marvellous Maeve is a spelluser who cannot cast much more than a cantrip, but has proven to be very skilled with those minor enchantments. She can be found putting on displays with the wide range of cantrips she knows that are suitable for entertaining, many of which Maeve has created herself. Maeve's skill with cantrips is such that she can put on a show that would put a more powerful spelluser to shame.

One page is the front cover, one page is the front matter and most of a page is ads.

boardgame.name: Treacherous Gold
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Treacherous Gold sees the characters stumble across a group of orcs escorting some hostages. The orcs think the characters are those they are meeting to exchange the hostages with for gold. The characters may choose to do so, or they may get ambushed by the orcs either before or after the exchange.

The encounter comes with two 24x24 battlemaps, one of the site of the initial meeting and one of a potential ambush site.

This is aimed at d100 systems but is generic enough in nature to be adapted to others.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

One page is the cover, one the front matter, one page is ads and twenty-four pages have the two battlemaps and printing plans.

boardgame.name: My Date with a Zombie
boardgame.description:
You task is to get your Zombie ready for their date by finding their lost pieces (Head, Body, Arms, Legs) and when possible getting a bonus item to make the date extra special (Flowers, Golf Clubs, Climbing Rope, etc). This is done by drawing from a deck of cards with a variety of zombie parts associated with a variety of dates.

Each round you choose from a variety of actions (place, swap, draw, trade, bid or start over) in an effort to build the best date you can. Points are awarded based on the success of getting ready for your date, the bonus items and how carefully you manage your bidding. The player with the highest score after the agreed upon number of rounds wins the game.

With a wonderful balance of strategy and luck, this fun and quirky game if suited for 2-6 players and generally plays in 15-45 minutes depending on how many rounds you choose to play.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Under Anisa's Tower
boardgame.description:
Anisa was a powerful mage that discovered an ancient crystal buried under whisperwood. After attempting to harness it's power something went wrong and she was never heard of again.

It's a one page dungeon

Publishers Blurb

boardgame.name: The Siege of La Crenoil: Fleischer's Revenge
boardgame.description:
This is the fourth in a series of mini campaign books.

This volume, The Siege of La Crenoilis following a similar format to its predecessors.

Table Top Teasers are scenarios for wargames by another name.

The intention is to provide the players with a credible military setting and objectives, which allow for rather more than simply lining up two similar armies and having a go at each other to until one destroys the other. It provides the context for the military action and allows for battles where, with quite uneven forces, both have a chance of victory depending on the setting and objectives.

This one is about a siege, in the context of a mini campaign (using a map and fighting each scenario as it arises), but without the need for much of the campaign mechanics.

There are some basic rules that cover the siege works, firing and damage.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: mid-18th century Table-top Teasers (Charles S. Grant)

boardgame.name: Attack on the Jünger
boardgame.description:
Attack on the Jünger contains a mini campaign with 5 stand alone scenarios.
2 small actions, 2 medium sized and 1 large (2 days) scenarios

Scenario 1 - Surprise Attack at Haux
Scenario 2 - Attack on Faloux
Scenario 3 - Action at Tasque
Scenario 4 - Battle for Haux
Scenario 5 - Battle for Blaise - Day One
Scenario 5 - Battle for Blaise - Day Two
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: mid-18th century Table-top Teasers (Charles S. Grant)

boardgame.name: Border Raid: "Pillage in Procrastor"
boardgame.description:
6th mini campaign book dealing with the fictitious wars of the Grand Duchy of Lorraine and the Vereinigte Freie Städte (VFS).

This campaign is completely different from those described in previous books. The previous books have led the readers and players through number of set piece scenarios. The actions that took place in this campaign were not pre-planned but created by the orders and actions of the players involved. They have been described here and could be replayed. However, dozens of quite different actions might be the result of fighting this campaign.

Day One - The Raid Begins
Day Two - A Gathering Storm
Day Three - Actions and Ambush
Day Four - The Chase
Day Five - End Game
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: mid-18th century Table-top Teasers (Charles S. Grant)

boardgame.name: The Cat Will Mew and Dog Will Have HIs Day
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

“The Cat will Mew and Dog will Have his Day” is the first chapter of the Apocalypse Meow storyline, of which there are intended to be six parts. Chapter one is a starting adventure for new players. The storyline is designed to start with first-level cats and have the characters develop over the course of the storyline.

boardgame.name: World War III: The Complete Starter Set
boardgame.description:
The World War III Complete Starter is the ultimate way to start playing World War III: Team Yankee and contains 16 tanks, including the T-80 Soviet Main Battle Tank, BMP-3 Armoured Fighting Vehicle, as well as the American Bradley and M1A1 Main Battle Tank.

It also includes dice, rulebook and a quick start guide to help you launch your gaming experience.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: World War III – Team Yankee 2 (Battlefront)

listing.notes:
1 Team Yankee "WWIII" The Complete Starter Set contains:
1 Complete USA Force 1 Complete Soviet Force 1 Complete World War III: Team Yankee Mini Sized Rulebook 1 Quick Start Guide Unit Cards 20 Dice The United States has the most powerful armed forces in the world. Three army corps stand ready to defend Western Europe from the red horde poised across the Iron Curtain. Armoured troops’ powerful M60 Patton tanks or state of the art M1 or IPM1 Abrams tanks, mechanized infantry mounted in reliable M113 personnel carriers, and light infantry of the 82nd Airborne all stand ready to stop the red tide.
Supplied unpainted & unassembled

boardgame.name: Printer Friendly Dungeon Tiles
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These tiles are a slight redesign of CSP's Basic Dungeon Tiles range - and have been presented here as black & white images, with a minimal background/wall texture.

This set also utilises a simple three tile system* - which means that you no longer need to print out a different tile for every possible room or passage configuration - as well as making them ideal for creating a random dungeon (battle)map on the fly!

* i.e. a passage tile, a small room tile, and a large room tile - all of which can be modified with the use of small tile overlays.

boardgame.name: Bad Dogs: The Back-Alley Retrievers
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

The Back-Alley Retrievers are some of the worst dogs in all of Pugmire, a fanatical group of dogs that believe Pugmire is only for dogs. They target non-dogs in Pugmire to drive out all who are different than them.


A look at who the Back-Alley Retrievers are and how a Guidecan integrate them intotheir game
Plots, organization structure, and plot hooks to grab players’attention
New antagonists to challenge the good dogs of Pugmire

boardgame.name: A Dogs Guide to Solo Play
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

This booklet contains additional rules to allow Pubmire to be played without a Guide.

If you are not familiar with solo role-play and how it works, the rules are explained and supported. Additionally, I am frequently on the Onyx Path discord so you can talk to me directly (Peter R).

These rules are built explicitly for Pugmire. They use game mechanics you are already familiar with so when you have to use the solo rules, you don't have to mentally flip from your character in Canis Minor, break the flow of your game to use the solo rules, and then get back into character.

The book is listed as 14 pages. All the actual rules require are three tables. The other 10 pages of text are there to explain and support solo playing Pugmire and let you get the most out of this addition.

Compatible with Pugmire

boardgame.name: Reigning Cats and Dogs Vol II: Cunning Cats
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Add a touch of guile to your cunning cats!

While their names should echo in the history books of Mau, there's previous few examples of the house agents who maintain the balance between the Monarchies of Mau.

Worry no longer! Reigning Cats and Dogs offers you new ways to quickly create house agents in the Monarchies of Mau.

By answering a few simple questions, guides can generate shrewd and influential agents who work for the noble houses of Mau. Guides can also choose from numerous NPCs who help or hinder the agent—and in turn, the players that agents have hired.

This product also presents guidelines for creating minor houses for use in your own Monarchies of Mau campaign.

Inside, you can also find:

1 new minor house in Mau;
34 new NPCs;
10 secretive informants;
10 new Disputed Tenets of Mau; and
More adventure hooks that a clever cat could hope to cover up!


Check out Vol II: Cunning Cats today!

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: DiceFest 2019 Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
3 promo cards given away to attendees of DiceFest 2019. Contained the following cards:

Vicious Enemies (Low Threat, Promo #334)
Vicious Enemies (Medium Threat, Promo #335)
Vicious Enemies (High Threat, Promo #336)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death

boardgame.name: The Green Hawk
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the Book

An exciting, dungeon-style adventure ready-to-go for Pugmire campaigns, The Green Hawk takes characters on a dangerous ride down the river to seek out long-forgotten ruins. With friendly hunter Jett to guide them, they’ll face jungle threats, meet a band of feline pi-rates and explore an ancient place that may spell their doom!

This adventure is complete with maps and monsters, including four new jungle terrors, and everything needed to guide players through the story. There is even a new, unique Masterwork for those brave dogs who are tough enough to survive to the end!

boardgame.name: Gone To See The Elephant: Miniatures War Game Rules for The Mexican-American War, 1846-1848
boardgame.description:
Utilizing the basic game model first published in John Company, Gone To See The Elephant GTSTE requires absolutely no written record keeping, and as few as three standard six-sided dice.

Play is card driven, with random order of movement with players commanding Brigades composed of from two to five infantry battalions or cavalry regiments, possibly with an artillery battery.

How many Orders a General can issue in a turn to the units in a Brigade depends on his pre-determined Generalship, and the draw of a card from the Orders Deck for his level.

Orders are placed before movement each turn, then units check their Resolve to see how well those orders are obeyed--or possibly not at all!

Fire is calculated by weapon, troop types, unit Resolve, and number of Bases. Losses are taken in Bases as well.

Uncontrolled and unexpected Events can result from the effects of enemy fire, but also randomly. A distinct and separate Mexican and US Army Event Deck is provided. Unique and historical occurrences impossible to write rules for, but which could or did happen in fact, are now part of the mix as players seek to create a battle plan then react as best they can when it actually makes contact with the enemy.

Prairie fires, false truce, amazing individual acts of courage, etc, all could influence battle in Mexico, and can for the players, too.

GTSTE also provides optional Rules, including Ammunition, Stamina and Fatigue, Skirmishers, Sappers, Night Fighting, and Weather, among others.

Special Resolve advantages are available to the Mexican force which can field in miniature figures for the conduct of pre-battle Mass, a military band, field hospital, and Soldaderas supporting the soldiers.

Introducing an innovative ground scale system for basing, the game may be played with ANY size figures, from 5/6mm,10mm, 15mm, 25/28mm to 40mm, using the same 1” x .75” and 2” x 1.5” square bases without effecting movement or weapons ranges. Artillery is mounted on pre-measured triangular templates (provided with the rules) indicating maximum firing angles eliminating the need for measuring in play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: d66 Gossip About a Ruler or Noble
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

d66 Gossip About a Ruler or Noble gives you 36 different ideas for idiosyncrasies that the public has heard about, whether or not these are true. Perfect for games intrigue or if you are trying to make a particular NPC memorable, these ideas will give you the ideas you need exactly when you need them.

boardgame.name: d66 Military Unit Nicknames
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

d66 Military Unit Nicknames gives a ideas for your military character's old unit. This can help you describe your unit and flesh our your character's backstory.

boardgame.name: d66 Scout Unit Nicknames
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

d66 Scout Unit Nicknames gives a ideas for your scout character's old unit. This can help you describe your unit and flesh our your character's backstory.

boardgame.name: d66 Adventure
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore ancient ruins, monster-haunted and imbued with eldritch energies. Delve into dungeons, dark and deep. Trek through uncharted wilderlands. Discover wondrous marvels, mind-blowing horrors and mysteries of forgotten ages. Battle savage raiders, bloodthirsty monsters and horrors from other worlds. And claim every copper coin you find.

Enter new realms of fantasy adventure with D66 Adventure. D66 Adventure brings you a simple fantasy role-playing game for one or more players. Character creation is quick, the rules simple, comprehensive and easy to use and the possibilities are limitless. These core rules include character creation, spells, equipment, adventuring and character development. Although d66 are used for action checks, the game uses a full set of gaming dice. You can play d66 Adventure with a GM, the game was written for those that want to play fun and exciting adventures, complete with stats, encounter areas, monsters, treasures, events, etc..., solo or with a group, with or without a GM.

So strap on your sword and brace your shield, gather some companions or brave the adventure on your own. There’s villagers to save, monsters to slay and sack loads of treasure to claim!

boardgame.name: Event Pack I: Ruins of Grimhold Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Event Pack I: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep brings you 18 Event cards you can use to play DG0 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep with d66 Adventure. The cards include full stats for the monsters that haunt the keep and the traps and hazards that can be encountered there. Complete rules for monster special abilities is also included! Explore the keep like never before with d66 Adventure. Best of all you can use the cards in your own adventures or to explore other Universal Adventures titles.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The ruins above the Dungeons of Grimhold Keep are now open for adventure! Once a dwarven stronghold guarding the Great Trade Road, Grimhold Keep has fallen into ruin. But within the shadowed structures and crumbling towers monsters lurk and treasure waits to be claimed! Explore the Wizard’s Tower and the Haunted Hall and when you are ready continue the adventure in DG1 The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep.

boardgame.name: Treasure Pack I
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

d66 Adventure Treasure Pack I brings you 18 Treasure cards you can use with your d66 Adventure games. You can use them along with d66 Adventure Event pack I or other d66 Adventure titles or your own adventures. You can also use the cards from the Treasure pack, in conjunction with the d66 Adventure Event pack I and the Dungeon Deck to create your own adventures.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: The Courtyard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Great treasures await those daring enough to brave the dangers of the Ruins of Grimhold Keep and the dungeons beneath. The first expansion pack for The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, the Courtyard brings you 9 Custom Encounter cards for the Courtyard encounter area and a few new rules for using the cards. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, these cards can be used wherever you want to place the Courtyard.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Gatehouse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore the ruined gatehouse in search of gold, glory and adventure! But beware, rumors abound of dangers within the ruins, including new bands of humanoid raiders and strange undead. The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Gatehouse brings you everything you need to explore the ruined gatehouse, including introductory material, an Adventure Record and 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards. The adventure also includes several unique encounters, new treasures and a few new mechanics for exploring a multi-level structure. The ruined gatehouse can be used as an independent adventure site or as part of the Ruins of Grimhold Keep, with a new entrance to the dungeons beneath.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: The Haunted Barracks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lost wealth, arms and armor may lie within the ruined barracks, but who knows what horrors may lurk within the shadowed hall. The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: The Haunted Barracks brings you 9 special Search cards for the Barracks encounter area within The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, including new dangers and a unique treasure. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, these cards can be used wherever you want to place the Haunted Barracks.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Tower of the Spider
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A bold foray into the northeast tower could garner you untold riches or an untimely end. Dare you venture into the Tower of the Spider? The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Tower of the Spider brings you details of the tower and everything you need to explore the dungeon level immediately beneath the tower, including introductory material, an Adventure Record and 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards. The adventure also includes several unique encounters and treasures. The ruined tower can be used as an independent adventure site or as part of the Ruins of Grimhold Keep, with a new entrance to the dungeons beneath.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Tower of Wizardry
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Eldritch energy radiates from the mysterious tower that looms over the ruins. But what awaits those that enter this arcane edifice none can say. Rumors become legends whisper of gold and jewels, halls of gem stones, and enchanted objects, but what hazards guard these treasures none can say. A bold band of adventurers, experienced and well equipped, may have the means to enter this site and return to tell the tale.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Wizard's Tower - Chamber of Ice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Danger, treasure and adventure await within the frigid confines of the Chamber of Ice. Chamber of Ice is an expansion pack for DG0E Tower of Wizardry, located in The Ruins of Grimholod Keep, which is above The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep. The expansion pack brings you 9 special Search cards for the Chamber of Ice encounter area within DG0E, including new monster encounter, treasures and special events. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0E The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, Tower of Wizardry, these cards can be used wherever you want to place the Chamber of Ice.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Wizard's Tower - Chamber of Earth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Danger, treasure and adventure await among the statues and large mounds of earth scattered within the Chamber of Earth. Chamber of Earth is an expansion pack for DG0E Tower of Wizardry, located in The Ruins of Grimholod Keep, which is above The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep. The expansion pack brings you 9 special Search cards for the Chamber of Earth encounter area within DG0E, including monsters, treasures and more. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0E The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, Tower of Wizardry, these cards can be used wherever you want to place the Chamber of Earth.

boardgame.name: The Waters Above: Prelude
boardgame.description:
A giant dome called the Vault of Heaven covers the earth, separating it from the vast ocean of the heavens. In this world, sea nymphs care for the stars in the sky, dedicating their lives to it. However, magic is fading, the stars are dying, and no one knows why. No one even speaks of it, carrying on like they have for tens of thousands of years, as if nothing has changed. In these circumstances, three sea nymphs and the living embodiment of a star struggle to find meaning in their lives and their fading world.

The Waters Above: Prelude is a free prequel to the upcoming kinetic yuri novel, The Waters Above presenting four short episodes each starring a main character from the game. Maera: A young and well-respected starkeeper. Clio: Maera's girlfriend and the head of maintenance for the Celestial authority. Iris: The assistant archivist and researcher trying desperately to save the stars. Apple: The star in Maera's care, and the first in ten thousand years to have a human form.

Features
-Stunning character art from Namie and beautiful backgrounds from Loika
-Original soundtrack by Kris "Astartus" Flacke
-Accessibility options
-Extra features including a music room, CG viewer, and guest art gallery

Not included is a handkerchief for your tears.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Wizard's Tower - Chamber of Water
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Danger, treasure and adventure await in and along the banks of the river in the Chamber of Water. Chamber of Water is an expansion pack for DG0E Tower of Wizardry, located in The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, which is above The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep. The expansion pack brings you 9 special Search cards for the Chamber of Water encounter area within DG0E, including monsters, treasures and more. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0E The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, Tower of Wizardry, these cards can be used wherever you want to place the Chamber of Water.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Wizard's Tower - Chamber of Fire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Danger and treasure await in the Chamber of Fire. Chamber of Fire is an expansion pack for DG0E Tower of Wizardry, located in The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, which is above The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep. The expansion pack brings you 9 special cards for the Chamber of Fire encounter area within DG0E, including monsters, treasures and more. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0E The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, Tower of Wizardry, these cards can be used wherever you want to place the Chamber of Fire.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Chapel of the Hammer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Discover the secrets and dangers of this mysterious chapel in The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Chapel of the Hammer. DG0F The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Chapel of the Hammer brings you 9 special Search cards for the Chapel encounter area within The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, including new dangers and a unique treasures. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, these cards can be used wherever you want to place the Chapel.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Wizard's Tower - Treasure Pack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tempt your characters to delve into the depths of the Wizard’s Tower with this free set of Treasure cards. DG0EA Wizard’s Tower Treasure Pack is a set of free Treasure cards you can add to DG0e The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Tower of Wizardry or any Universal Adventure game. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0e The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Tower of Wizardry, these cards can be used whenever you wish.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Tower of the Beast
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bloodstained bones are scattered across the floor of this ruined tower and a great heap of rubble is piled in the center of the floor. A foul stench, like the den of a monstrous beast, rises from the dark depths at the end of a spiral staircase.

Prepare for a bold foray into the northwest tower of the Ruins of Grimhold Keep and discover wealth and magic or an untimely end. Dare you venture into the Tower of the Beast? The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Tower of the Beast brings you everything you need to explore the dungeon level beneath the tower, including introductory material, an Adventure Record and 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards. The adventure also includes several unique encounters and treasures. The ruined tower can be used as an independent adventure site or as part of the Ruins of Grimhold Keep, with a new entrance to the dungeons beneath.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Dungeon of the Hammer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The block of blue and silver stone, emblazoned with the radiate image of a hammer, slowly slides aside, revealing a broad flight of dust-covered stairs leading down into darkness.

The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Dungeon of the Hammer takes you beneath the Chapel of the Hammer, within the Ruins of Grimhold Keep, with a full set of cards, including 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards, 18 Treasure cards and 45 Custom Encounter cards. This super-sized adventure module brings you numerous unique encounters, settings and hazards to test your adventurers and unique treasures to reward their success. The Dungeon of the Hammer can be used as an independent adventure site or as part of the Ruins of Grimhold Keep and the Chapel of the Hammer.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep (OSRIC)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Once a dwarven stronghold guarding the Great Trade Road, Grimhold Keep has fallen into ruin. But within the shadowed structures and crumbling towers monsters lurk and treasure waits to be claimed!

B1 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, is a dungeon adventure for 4 to 6 characters of 1st to 3rd level. Once a dwarven stronghold guarding the Great Trade Road, the keep has fallen into ruin, but the remains of the towers and ruined structures may conceal lost wealth and lurking danger. Based on the Universal Adventure module of the same name, the adventure includes 9 Adventure cards, each with a thumbnail map, description and notes, 9 Encounter cards, with full stats, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards. Written for Labyrinth Lord (tm) and similar RPGs, the adventure can be played solo or with a group, with or without a GM. The adventure is highly re-playable and the cards can be combined with those from other adventures to create your own adventures. Gather your party and delve into the depths of Grimhold Keep in search of gold, glory and adventure!
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, Level 1 (OSRIC)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Once a dwarven stronghold guarding the Great Trade Road, the Grimhold Keep has fallen into ruin. Rumors claim, though, that an extensive network of tunnels and chambers exists beneath the ruins. Home to all manner of horrors and traps, the dungeons are also said to house the hoarded wealth of marauding bandits and monsters. Only a brave party of adventurers can survive the dangers to discover the truth.

Enter the depths of Grimhold Keep in search of gold, glory and adventure. But beware, the denizens of the dark depths are a danger to all who dare to enter their domain. And there are rumors of a new power rising, one that bears the symbol of the crowned skull.

B2 The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep, Level 1, a dungeon adventure for 4 to 6 characters of 1st to 3rd level. Once a dwarven stronghold guarding the Great Trade Road, the keep has fallen into ruin, but legends tell of an extensive network of chambers and tunnels beneath the keep. Based on the Universal Adventure module of the same name, the adventure includes 9 Adventure cards, each with a thumbnail map, description and notes, 9 Encounter cards, with full stats, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards. Written for Labyrinth Lord (tm) and similar RPGs, the adventure can be played solo or with a group, with or without a GM. The adventure is highly re-playable and the cards can be combined with those from other adventures to create your own adventures. Gather your party and delve into the depths of Grimhold Keep in search of gold, glory and adventure!
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep, Level 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Once a dwarven stronghold guarding the Great Trade Road, the Grimhold Keep has fallen into ruin. Rumors claim, though, that an extensive network of tunnels and chambers exists beneath the ruins. Home to all manner of horrors and traps, the dungeons are also said to house the hoarded wealth of marauding bandits and monsters. Only a brave party of adventurers can survive the dangers to discover the truth.

This Adventure Module includes introductory material, an Adventure Record and 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards. The adventure continues in DG2.

boardgame.name: The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep, Level 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Continue your adventures into the depths of Grimhold Dungeon with The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep Level 2. This Adventure Module includes introductory material, an Adventure Record and 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards. The module continues the adventure begun in DG1 The Dungeons of Grimhold Keep Level 1 and DG0 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep, which details the ruined keep.

boardgame.name: Dungeon of the Hammer: Treasure Pack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tempt your characters to delve into the depths of the Dungeon of the Hammer with this free set of Treasure cards. DG0F1A Dungeon of the Hammer: Treasure Pack is a set of free Treasure cards you can add to DG0F1 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Dungeon of the Hammer or any Universal Adventures adventure. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0F1 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Dungeon of the Hammer , these cards can be used whenever you wish.

boardgame.name: Dungeon of the Hammer: Treasure Pack II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tempt your characters to delve into the depths of the Dungeon of the Hammer with this free set of Treasure cards. DG0F1B Dungeon of the Hammer: Treasure Pack II is a set of free Treasure cards you can add to DG0F1 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Dungeon of the Hammer or any Universal Adventures adventure. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0F1 The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Dungeon of the Hammer , these cards can be used whenever you wish.

boardgame.name: Tower of the Beast: Shrine of the Wolf
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Great treasures await those daring enough to brave the dangers of the Ruins of Grimhold Keep and the dungeons beneath. The first expansion pack for Tower of the Beast, Shrine of the Wolf brings you 9 Event cards for the Shrine of the Wolf encounter area in the Tower of the Beast. Although specifically designed to be used with Universal Adventures Adventure Module DG0G The Ruins of Grimhold Keep: Tower of the Beast, these cards can be used wherever you want to place the Shrine of the Wolf.

boardgame.name: One Last Job
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

CAN YOUR HEROES ALLY WITH FEY FORCES TO DEFEAT OLHYDRA?

At last, the enemy behind the floods in the Feywild is revealed. However, the watery nemesis is far more frightening than initially thought. Can your adventuring party rise to a challenged birthed in the watery depths? An Epic Fey Battle to Conclude the “At Jeny’s Request” Series

A Four/Six-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

boardgame.name: A Snip Here, a Stitch There
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Can Your Heroes Help Mordenkainen Defeat an Old Foe from Greyhawk?

Mysterious dead magic zones are popping up in areas consecrated to gods, with deadly consequences. Can you get to the bottom of it before more lives are lost?

A Four/Six Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: RPG Review (Issue 47 - June 2020)
boardgame.description:
RPG Review
Issue 47
June 2020
IN SICKNESS AND IN HEALTH

From the cover:
TP Total Pan … Hit Point Systems … PreGen Healers … Disease in RQ … Eclipse Phase .. Tales from the Loop: Worse Than Death .. D&D Demigods … Radioactive Review ... and much more!

boardgame.name: Medieval Hermits
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When I first started playing Dungeons & Dragons as a kid, it sparked a lifelong interest in history. Mythology, folklore, and fantasy fiction were great, but I was amazed at the weapons, places, and events that had actually existed in the real world! I read everything that I could get my hands on. Of particular interest were any books about Europe during the Middle Ages, because that period was obviously one of the biggest influences on the game.

Understanding how people had lived informed the characters created, the worlds I built, and the adventures I ran. How things got done without technology is fascinating. The political, religious, and cultural institutions that controlled things remain both inspiring and terrifying. Even tiny details of the clothing people wore, and what they ate, continue to be interesting to me. Infusing what I learned from history into my campaigns gave them texture, brought them to life, and made them more immersive.

I understand that modern fantasy has been moving away from medievalism for a while now. There are good reasons for that. Escapism should, to some degree, reflect modern issues and concerns. That means that tabletop roleplaying has to change to keep up with shifts in our interests, beliefs, and aspirations. Leaving behind legacies of racism, sexism, and violence isn’t a bad thing. Building worlds, characters, and campaigns that are less Euro-centric invites more people into the community, and brings fresh perspectives and ideas that keep our precious hobby alive.

The Medieval Mind series isn’t meant to diminish any of that. We can learn from history, the good and the bad, the high points and the low, and then change it all in the worlds of our imagination. Grasping how and why institutions came about, what motivated people, and the way cultures developed, can provide insight that’s useful for worldbuilding.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

boardgame.name: Skirmish: 52C – Player Printouts
boardgame.description:
This high-resolution PDF file contains the following resources for you to print, cut-out, and otherwise use to improve your SKIRMISH: 52C experience:

(1) Squad Roster
(1) Player's Aid
(52) 32mm "Red Team" model tokens
(52) 32mm "Blue Team" model tokens
(52) Playing Cards

boardgame.name: Dungeon Scum
Dungeonscum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Who said Dungeoneering had to be dreary?"

Based on the Starport Scum scifi rules, Dungeon Scum is a narrative wargame intended to be played by role players and war gamers alike.

Gather your group of adventurers, set out on a dungeon delve and hope you make it back!

Get loot, see the sights, maybe go on an epic quest.

Dungeon Scum sets itself apart in a few ways:


The combat rules are fast, simple and easy to remember, allowing you to fight multiple encounters in one gaming session.



Unlike many RPG's, it includes a morale system for more realistic combats.



It can be played solo, with encounter tables and monster lists for a fully random delve.



It can be turned into a full-fledged role playing game.



Characters can generated randomly in a few rolls or simply described with a couple of common-sense sentences.


Your hero is a SWORDFIGHTER with QUICK REFLEXES and a VOW OF SILENCE? Good, that's all we needed to know.


Loot is well supplied with tons of magical items to find.



6 types of magic with 10 spells in each system, plus "quest" spells used in campaign play.



Campaign rules for letting your heroes become stronger..if they don't die.



While the game is intended to use miniature figures, advice is provided to players who prefer playing without them.


And a lot more.

boardgame.name: Shade Stone Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An adventure delve location.

From the introduction:

Welcome to the first “Delve” supplement for Dungeon Scum.

The core rules offer a generic dungeon-delve system for exploring decrepit pits in the ground.

This expansion pack offers new tables to use in place of the ones in the core rules.

With these tables, you’ll be able to adventure in a new location with unique risks, threats and
rewards.

boardgame.name: Frog Pond Vale
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An adventure location for Dungeon Scum.

From the introduction:

Frog Pond Vale is a new adventure location that can be dropped seamlessly into a campaign of Dungeon Scum.

Your characters can visit, get themselves into trouble and be off again, without a major commitment.

boardgame.name: Village Generator for Dungeon Scum & Other Fantasy Adventure Games
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a tool set to help you create an interesting village that could be a focal point for an adventure, a short campaign or even act as the home base for extended adventuring.

While intended for the Dungeon Scum rules, it is written to be usable with many other fantasy game rules, whether for skirmish wargaming or fully fledged role playing game campaigns.

boardgame.name: Variant Rules Pack 1
boardgame.description:
For Dungeon Scum and Starport Scum

From the introduction:

One of the beauties of the Scum system is that it is extremely easy to customize to provide exactly the type of game the group wants.

Whether it is to make the game faster and easier or to add additional detail, this booklet will help you "dial in" the game to the exact level of detail you want.

boardgame.description:
The Scummer
Issue 1
2017

boardgame.name: The Scummer (Issue 2 - 2017)
boardgame.description:
The Scummer
Issue 2

boardgame.name: Hanamikoji: Playmat
boardgame.description: Official 14x24" Hanamikoji playmat.

boardgame.name: Mahjong: Playmat
boardgame.description: There are many designs of Mahjong playmats, but the traditional design have the four winds oriented as on a celestial map, not a terrestial map. The symbols East 东(東), South 南, West 西 and North 北 should go counter-clockwise instead of clockwise.

boardgame.name: Body Open Source
boardgame.description:
A multi-user experience (4 x VR headset) in virtual reality that touches on the subject of intimacy and crossing the borders of corporeality. This installation is implemented in the Virtual Reality medium. One of the main thematic platforms addressed in the work is the theme of the network and its structures, through the prism of somaesthetics (philosophy of the body) also touching upon the issues of body / identity - both real and virtual. Body Open Source is a form of collective exploration (enabled for up to four users / “spectactors”) on the platform of pleasure in which the impulse, the reflex/neural impulse generated by the real body has the opportunity to become visible between bodies in a technological equivalent of the new organica - a virtual body.

Where does the real body end and the virtual body begin? Does their co-existence facilitate crossing the boundaries in the projection and constructing of a "virtual"? Are the real and virtual limits of intimacy the same? Each of the four users, thanks to the tools in the form of virtual reality headsets, undergoes the process of expanding, growing into their own "virtual body". The users immerse themselves in the virtual space at the same time, leading to a digitized co-presence. Connected to a small network thanks to the server that is part of the installation, they become a network of bodies - inclined to experiment with the limits of their own new corporality, interacting with each other as graceful, hyperflexible avatars who receive and release visible neural impulses.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 A MAZE. Awards Most Amazing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: The Under Presents
boardgame.description: The Under Presents merges VR and immersive theater. The game has several unique innovations including the use of live actors to inhabit NPCs while the players and actors are remote in Quest/Rift headsets. Our cast of 18 helps flesh out the lore of the world and performs everyday (2 an hour) from 8am-10pm PST. This run of live actors began in November and may conclude in April. Beyond that, there is a full-multiplayer game and 6-8 hours of a single-player experience.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 A MAZE. Awards Most Amazing Game of the Year Nominee
2020 SXSW Best VR Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Too Many Cooks
boardgame.description: .M.Cooks is 1-6 local co-op game for mobile where your party runs a kitchen, chaotically juggling cooking, time and sending ingredients between their team! Players will need to talk, shout and discuss to organise both their pipeline and team!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 A MAZE. Awards Most Amazing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Knife Sisters
boardgame.description: In Knife Sisters, the player explores emotions, consent, power and dependency in a safe setting. Follow non-binary Leo during six weeks of budding emotions, occult rituals, and consensual sex. Explore power balances through the relationships with different characters. What will they make you do?
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 A MAZE. Awards Long Feature Award Winner
